Article Title: "Going to be a big addition": Matthew Stafford shares excitement over Rams' blockbuster signing of Davante Adams ahead of the 2025 NFL season
Article Text:
Credit: Getty Images

Matthew Stafford thrilled about Rams landing Davante Adams, calls it a game-changing move



The Los Angeles Rams are gearing up for an electrifying season, fueled by the leadership of veteran quarterback Matthew Stafford and the high-profile acquisition of wide receiver Davante Adams . With Adams joining the offense, the Rams are making a bold statement about their ambitions in the ever-competitive NFC West . However, the transition comes with challenges, particularly following the departure of longtime star Cooper Kupp to a divisional rival.After a turbulent period following their Super Bowl victory, the Rams are determined to reclaim their status as one of the NFL’s elite teams. The front office made a major splash in free agency by signing Davante Adams to a lucrative two-year, $44 million deal, solidifying their receiving corps. Adams, a three-time All-Pro, brings a wealth of experience and an established reputation as one of the league’s premier wideouts. Despite a less-than-stellar season with the New York Jets, his track record—including five consecutive 1,000-yard campaigns—suggests he still has plenty left in the tank.Matthew Stafford, who has seen his fair share of ups and downs with the franchise, expressed his excitement about the addition of Adams. “I have a ton of respect for him, the way he goes about his business and the way he plays the game,” Stafford shared with the Los Angeles Times. “He’s been a big-time in this league for a long time, so happy to have him. I know he’s going to be a big addition to our team.”While Adams is expected to take on a significant role, the Rams’ receiving hierarchy will still revolve around rising star Puka Nacua . Adams’ ability to complement Nacua rather than directly replace Kupp could be the key to unlocking the Rams’ offensive potential.The departure of Cooper Kupp, one of the most beloved figures in Rams history, left a significant void. The former Super Bowl MVP was a pillar of the franchise, and his move to the Seattle Seahawks added an extra layer of intrigue to the upcoming season. Stafford acknowledged the emotional aspect of losing a key teammate but expressed his well wishes for Kupp. “A great teammate, a great Ram—I think everybody here knows that and can appreciate what he was for our team and what he was for this community,” Stafford noted. “Happy that he landed somewhere he wanted to be and got the deal he deserved.”With Kupp now in Seattle, the Rams will face their former star at least twice a year, setting the stage for must-watch matchups. The NFC West rivalry between the Rams and Seahawks has been intense in recent years, and Kupp’s presence on the other side will only amplify the stakes.For Los Angeles, the focus now shifts to ensuring Adams thrives in Sean McVay’s offensive system. Unlike Kupp, who battled injuries in recent seasons, Adams has remained more durable, giving Stafford a reliable target who can stretch the field. At 32 years old, Adams still possesses the skill set that made him one of the most feared receivers in the league. With McVay’s creative play-calling and Stafford’s arm strength, the Rams’ offense could be poised for a resurgence.Also Read: "Ugly, stupid, miserable”: Taylor Swift’s ex-boyfriend’s brother faces backlash over comments about the Pop Star As the season approaches, all eyes will be on how quickly Adams gels with his new team. If he can recapture his dominant form, the Rams may find themselves right back in the mix for postseason contention—proving that their aggressive offseason moves were more than just a gamble.
Article Summary: Matthew Stafford thrilled about Rams landing Davante Adams, calls it a game- changing move. Rams are determined to reclaim their status as one of the NFL’s elite teams. The departure of Cooper Kupp to the Seattle Seahawks left a significant void.

Article Title: "Natural tension": Tom Brady reveals why his relationship with Bill Belichick was bound to end despite Patriots' two decades of dominance
Article Text:
Credit: Getty Images

Tom Brady opens up about the ‘tension’ with Bill Belichick that led to their Patriots split



Why Tom Brady chose Tampa Bay



Tom Brady and Bill Belichick: From tension to respect



Few partnerships in the history of sports have been as dominant as the one shared between Tom Brady and Bill Belichick . Together, they built a dynasty with the New England Patriots , capturing six Super Bowl titles and leaving an indelible mark on the NFL . However, all good things must come to an end, and in 2020, Brady made the pivotal decision to part ways with the franchise, signing with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers . While speculation and reports have long surrounded the reasons behind the breakup, Brady recently offered fresh insight into why their legendary run came to a close.In his weekly newsletter, The 199, Brady reflected on the inevitable separation, acknowledging that a natural tension had developed between himself and Belichick."The reality was, after twenty years together, a natural tension had developed between where Coach Belichick and I were headed in our careers, and where the Patriots were moving as a franchise," Brady wrote. "It was the kind of tension that could only be resolved by some kind of split or one of us reassessing our priorities."It was no secret that the Patriots' strict and often ruthless approach to roster management was a defining trait under Belichick. The team thrived on discipline, adaptability, and a business-first mentality, which worked wonders for two decades. But as Brady entered his forties, his priorities began to shift. He had already sacrificed financially for the team by signing team-friendly deals, and reports suggested that he grew frustrated with the lack of long-term commitment from the organization. ESPN’s Seth Wickersham detailed in his book It’s Better to Be Feared that Brady was discontented with how the team managed its finances and how little say he had in personnel decisions.Brady’s decision to leave was not made overnight. He admitted that thoughts of free agency lingered in his mind for "two to three years" before his departure."It was a creeping decision that lived passively in the back of my mind for [two to three] years," Brady explained. "Until March of 2020 when a whirlwind of a few days made me realize that a decision was coming sooner rather than later."With time running out and an uncertain future in New England, Brady opted for a fresh start in Tampa Bay. His decision, he said, came down to a meticulous evaluation process."I asked myself, as someone headed into their forties with school-age kids and twenty years' worth of battle scars, what truly mattered to me now?" Brady continued. "What I ended up with was a list of about twenty things that I then ranked and graded on a weighted scale from 1 to 3. In the end, I chose Tampa, almost exactly five years ago now, because, in the aggregate, it graded out higher than New England along those twenty or so dimensions. It’s not much more complicated than that."Though their final years together were marked by friction, time appears to have softened any lingering hard feelings. Brady and Belichick have spoken positively about each other in recent years, and Belichick was even an invited guest at Brady’s roast earlier this year. Additionally, when the Las Vegas Raiders were searching for a new head coach, Brady reportedly reached out to gauge Belichick’s interest in the position before the team ultimately hired Pete Carroll.Also Read: "Going to be a big addition": Matthew Stafford shares excitement over Rams' blockbuster signing of Davante Adams ahead of the 2025 NFL season While the breakup between Brady and the Patriots was inevitable, it’s clear that the quarterback has no regrets about his decision. His candid reflections confirm that the tension between himself and Belichick was real, but they also serve as a testament to the incredible success they achieved together. Their relationship may have had its share of friction, but their legacy as one of the greatest player-coach duos in sports history remains untouchable.
Article Summary: Tom Brady and Bill Belichick built a dynasty with the New England Patriots. In 2020, Brady left the Patriots to join the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. In his weekly newsletter, Brady reflected on the inevitable separation. He said there was a "natural tension" between himself and Belichick.

Article Title: NHL plans to make Alex Ovechkin's record-breaking goal a grand one
Article Text:
Credit: Getty Images

NHL to halt game for on-ice live ceremony



Ovechkin's CELEBRATION PLAN when he Breaks the Goal Record!

NHL delegation to keep close eye on Alex Ovechkin's chase



Alex Ovechkin remains focused as the record beckons



Everyone is excited about Alex Ovechkin’s possible game where he may be set to make history. While fans and analysts talk about how it will be celebrated, the National Hockey League (NHL) is not holding back in making his record-breaking achievement a grand one. With the Washington Capitals captain inching closer to Wayne Gretzky's historic all-time goal-scoring mark, the league has planned extensively to celebrate the milestone.When Alex Ovechkin scores his 895th career goal, officially breaking Wayne Gretzky's record, the NHL will freeze play for a ceremony. The ceremony will be limited to seven minutes, according to NHL insider Chris Johnston, to have as minimal an effect as possible on the rhythm of the game while still honouring Ovechkin's incredible achievement.“There’s actually going to be a ceremony in real time,” Johnston said. “This is a pretty special moment, a special goal. But they’re going to limit it to seven minutes. There will be a delay in whatever game when Ovechkin ultimately reaches this. It could be a big moment of a pretty big game, at least for one of the other teams.”The decision to cut back on the ceremony time is because while the Washington Capitals have already made it to the playoffs, visiting teams could be in do-or-die playoff battles. A long break would disrupt their rhythm, and therefore a brief tribute would be the most ideal.When Alex Ovechkin comes within four goals of breaking Wayne Gretzky's record, a special NHL delegation of 15 celebrity guests—Gretzky and Commissioner Gary Bettman among them—will be at every Washington Capitals game. This way, they are sure to see the historic occasion wherever it occurs.Interestingly, while there will be an on-ice ceremony of sorts when Ovechkin passes Gretzky's record, the bigger tribute will occur when he sits atop the record book. The NHL has said that this event will be given the seriousness and gravitas it merits, paying tribute to Ovechkin's achievement in the sport.Going into his Washington Capitals' next match-up with the Winnipeg Jets, Alex Ovechkin remains seven goals away from rewriting history books. Although he missed a goal during the Capitals' latest win at 6-3 against the Florida Panthers, the super winger recorded two significant assists to keep his team at the top of the Metropolitan Division.Also read: Alex Ovechkin rewrites NHL history, records his 15th NHL season with 35 or more goals With the Capitals resting on an astonishing 47-15-8 record, Ovechkin's feat will be simply the icing on the cake of what has proven to be a dominating season by the team. Pundits everywhere are holding their breath for that day when ‘ The Gr8 Chase ’ would finally come to an end and seal Ovechkin as the best goal-scorer in NHL history.
Article Summary: NHL to halt game for on-ice live ceremony when Alex Ovechkin breaks Wayne Gretzky's record. Ceremony will be limited to seven minutes, according to NHL insider Chris Johnston. A special NHL delegation of 15 celebrity guests will be at every Washington Capitals game.

NEW DELHI: Lucknow Super Giants ’ batter Nicholas Pooran was in a destructive mood as he unleashed a breathtaking onslaught against Delhi Capitals in their Indian Premier League 2025 season opener at the ACA-VDCA Stadium in Visakhapatnam on Monday. Pooran, known for his clean hitting, smashed seven towering sixes and six boundaries during his whirlwind knock of 75 off just 30 balls.The highlight of Pooran’s innings came in the 13th over, bowled by Delhi Capitals’ part-timer Tristan Stubbs, which turned out to be an absolute carnage. Stubbs started the over with a dot ball, giving the impression that he might be able to contain the explosive left-hander.However, it turned out to be the calm before the storm as Pooran went ballistic, smashing four successive sixes in the next four deliveries. To add salt to Stubbs’ wounds, the over ended with a blistering boundary as Pooran accumulated 28 runs from it. The over read: 0 6 6 6 6 4, leaving Stubbs visibly dejected and the Capitals in shock.Pooran's fireworks were complemented by Mitchell Marsh ’s explosive innings at the top, as he hammered 72 off just 36 balls, including six sixes and as many fours. The duo stitched a blazing 87-run partnership for the second wicket in just seven overs, propelling Lucknow Super Giants to a daunting total of 209 for 8 after being put into bat by Delhi Capitals’ captain Axar Patel.Mitchell Starc eventually bowled Pooran with a reverse-swing, but by then, the damage was already done. The Capitals were left with an uphill task as Pooran’s ferocious knock left the Visakhapatnam crowd in awe.The sensational batting display from Pooran has set the tone for Lucknow Super Giants' campaign, while Delhi Capitals will need to reassess their bowling strategy moving forward.
Article Summary: Lucknow Super Giants beat Delhi Capitals in their IPL 2025 season opener. Nicholas Pooran hit seven sixes and six boundaries during his whirlwind knock of 75 off just 30 balls. Pooran's fireworks were complemented by Mitchell Marsh's explosive innings at the top.

The duo, now leading different franchises, shared a light-hearted moment that left everyone smiling.Axar Patel, stepping up as the new Delhi Capitals skipper, walked out for the toss alongside Rishabh Pant, the freshly appointed captain of Lucknow Super Giants . The two greeted each other with a friendly hug, chatting and laughing as they prepared for the coin toss.When Axar won the toss and opted to bowl first, Pant couldn’t resist a playful tease. He cheekily chanted, "Batting first, batting first," prompting both captains to burst into hearty laughter. The warmth between the two friends set a positive tone ahead of the intense clash.Explaining his decision, Axar said, "We are going to bowl first. It's the dew factor, we don't want to take any risk. Article Title: Aaron Rodgers longs for Packers-like stability; Steelers should steer clear anyway
Article Text:
(Image via Imagn Images)

Pittsburgh Steelers offer Aaron Rodgers stability, but is it enough?

Aaron Rodgers won’t solve Steelers' fundamental problems

"The Pat McAfee Show."

Signing Aaron Rodgers hurts Steelers' long-term prospects

Read More

Aaron Rodgers is back in the spotlight, visiting teams and keeping everyone guessing about his next move, per Albert Breer. He dropped by the Pittsburgh Steelers facility on Friday, meeting GM Omar Khan, coach Mike Tomlin, offensive coordinator Arthur Smith, and other staff. Rodgers stayed from about 9am until 3pm, getting a feel for the Steelers' environment.Money doesn't seem like a significant factor here. Rodgers’ decision hinges primarily on finding a team culture matching what he once had in Green Bay. Ironically, after two drama-filled seasons with the Jets, Rodgers now openly admits his time in Wisconsin was better than he previously thought. Call it nostalgia or clarity gained through a tough stretch in New York, but people close to Rodgers confirm he's genuinely reconsidering his Green Bay years in a more positive light.Pittsburgh presents an appealing scenario if Rodgers wants familiarity. The Steelers franchise mirrors Green Bay’s stability—a family-owned feel, consistent culture, and veteran players hungry to win immediately. T.J. Watt, Minkah Fitzpatrick, Cam Heyward, and newly added DK Metcalf represent seasoned leadership Rodgers would appreciate.Yet the Steelers' interest feels shortsighted. Rodgers, turning 41, isn’t the quarterback who won multiple MVPs. He can still deliver remarkable plays occasionally, but age matters, and consistency fades.Sure, Rodgers might boost Pittsburgh by a couple of wins. If Mason Rudolph gives them eight victories, Rodgers could possibly elevate them to 10. But two extra wins aren’t transformative. Rodgers costs roughly $30 million more than Rudolph and brings an increased injury risk. Remember, Rodgers went down injured early in the 2023 season—he’s likely to miss more time.Even if Rodgers remains healthy, Pittsburgh isn’t equipped to topple the AFC North or make a deep playoff run. Rodgers won’t suddenly dominate elite quarterbacks in high-pressure games. He’s simply no longer at that elite level, and neither are the Steelers.Rodgers will unquestionably dominate headlines, especially through his regular appearances onIf Pittsburgh becomes a mess, Rodgers won’t shy away from publicly airing grievances. His presence would immediately overshadow the coaching staff, particularly offensive coordinator Arthur Smith, who would likely yield control to Rodgers. Even Tomlin would defer somewhat, although more subtly.Rodgers' motivation remains individualistic rather than team-driven. He’s never been a vocal leader, and that likely won't change at 41. Players like Cam Heyward—long-time Steelers leaders—would probably find Rodgers’ self-centered approach frustrating.Adding Rodgers might excite fans and sell tickets. "Hall of Fame quarterback joins Hall of Fame coach" is excellent for PR. But beyond initial excitement, it’s not beneficial long-term.Rodgers won’t drastically improve Pittsburgh’s position. It’s like treating a serious wound with a superficial fix—the problem remains underneath. For sustainable improvement, the Steelers should honestly embrace a down year.Think logically. History proves the Steelers succeed by bottoming out briefly, then selecting a top-tier quarterback. In 1970, a 1-13 season yielded Terry Bradshaw and Super Bowl victories followed. Similarly, a 6-10 record in 2003 got them Ben Roethlisberger, leading to two more titles.Yet, the Steelers stubbornly cling to mediocrity. Consistent 8-9 or 10-7 seasons deliver average draft picks, not franchise quarterbacks. Pursuing Rodgers continues Pittsburgh’s pattern of choosing short-term optics over long-term excellence.As harsh as it sounds, the Steelers need a 5-12 season more than they need Aaron Rodgers. It positions them perfectly for a premium quarterback prospect in the 2026 draft, which Pittsburgh itself will host. That scenario offers genuine, long-lasting improvement.Rodgers to Pittsburgh is exciting but superficial. If the Steelers genuinely prioritize future championships over immediate headlines, they’ll pass on Rodgers. But history suggests they’ll stubbornly stick to their current approach—and once again miss the point.
Article Summary: Aaron Rodgers is back in the spotlight, visiting teams and keeping everyone guessing about his next move. He dropped by the Pittsburgh Steelers facility on Friday, meeting GM Omar Khan, coach Mike Tomlin, offensive coordinator Arthur Smith, and other staff. Rodgers’ decision hinges primarily on finding a team culture matching what he once had in Green Bay.

Article Title: ‘Virat sir picked me up, said jaldi se bhaag ja’: 18-year-old fan who invaded Eden Gardens pitch banned for IPL season for 'touching god'
Article Text:
Kohli hugs Rituparno before security guards take him away

Banned from Eden this IPL season

KOLKATA/BURDWAN: For 18-year-old Rituparno Pakhira, a day in police custody is a small price to pay for "touching god" as is a ban on entering Eden Gardens for the rest of this IPL season. On Satuday evening, the HS student, also a budding cricketer, had scaled the fence at Eden and invaded the pitch to dive at his idol Virat Kohli's feet during the KKR vs RCB match. Kohli hugged him before security personnel whisked him away."The moment I touched his feet, Virat Kohli sir picked me up, asked my name and said jaldi se bhaag ja (run away fast). Kolhi sir even asked the security personnel coming to catch me to not hit me and asked them to escort me out of the ground gently," the 18-year-old gushed after being granted bail on Monday. He claimed he did not at all "regret" his act.Rituparno said, “I had planned to enter the ground at any cost and prepared myself. I do not have any regrets. I am very happy that I was successful and that Icould touch my god.”Arrested and slapped with BNS sections on application of criminal force, criminal trespass and reckless actions putting lives or safety of others in danger, Rituparno had been sent to police custody for a day on Sunday, with magistrate Kaustav Mukhopadhyay advising him to “be like Kohli in life” and not risk others’ lives by breaching security.On Monday, magistrate Mukhopadhyay turned down cops’ plea for further custody and granted him bail on the condition that he should not enter Eden for any IPL match this season or venture anywhere near the stadium. Rituparno’s mother, Kakali , also made a fervent appeal to police and judiciary to forgive her son and emphasised how he idolised Kohli.“He adores Virat Kohli. For him, he is god. We are requesting cops and judiciary to forgive him con sidering his age and career,” she said at her home in East Burdwan’s Jamalpur.His father, who was outside the court, said he was a farmer but did his best to fulfil his son’s desire of becoming a cricketer. An HS examinee from Parbatpur High School, Pakhira has been taking cricket coaching since the age of 12 at Netaji Athletics Club in Jamalpur. Now, he trains at aclub in Beleghata. On Sunday, he had told the court that it was his “childhood dream” to take Kohli’s blessings and that is why he had breached security.“The magistrate granted him bail on the condition that he cannot be seen inside or anywhere near Eden during this IPL season,” said Arup Chakraborty, public prosecutor at Bankshall court.
Article Summary: HS student Rituparno Pakhira, 18, scaled the fence at Eden and invaded the pitch to dive at his idol Virat Kohli's feet during the KKR vs RCB match. Kohli hugged him before security personnel whisked him away. He claimed he did not at all "regret" his act.

Article Title: 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli's in, but who's out? Selection dilemma as India look to seal series against England

CUTTACK: One look at the stands on Saturday evening at the Barabati Stadium , and one could have been forgiven for mistaking it for match day instead of match eve.The Odisha Cricket Association 's (OCA) decision to open part of the stands for fans to watch India train, for free, ahead of the crucial second ODI against England here was a hit, with the stadium nearly half full.The loudest cheers from the 20,000-plus crowd were reserved for the man who missed the first ODI in Nagpur with a sore right knee — Virat Kohli Saturday's nets, however, suggested Kohli was not going to sit out another game. One of the fittest cricketers around, the former India captain last missed a match — before the Nagpur ODI — more than three years ago, the Johannesburg Test against South Africa in Jan 2022. Fit and raring to go, the star batter was the first to hit the nets and batted for nearly an hour before leaving the ground first, shouldering his cricket coffin.While England completely skipped Saturday's practice, many India players also skipped the optional session, including last-match hero Shreyas Iyer , vice-captain Shubman Gill , debutant Harshit Rana, comeback man Mohammed Shami, Hardik Pandya and Axar Patel."Virat Kohli is fit to play. He has come for practice and is good to go," batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said during the prematch media interaction.With a fit-again Kohli back in the playing XI, India will face a selection dilemma as they prepare to tick all the boxes ahead of the Champions Trophy and seal the series before going to Ahmedabad.Will Iyer lose his place to Kohli if the team management decides to continue with Yashasvi Jaiswal to keep the left-right opening combination going with captain Rohit Sharma ? Kotak, however, bypassed any queries on who should make way for Kohli on Sunday."I think that's what the head coach and captain can talk about. But yes, definitely a lefty-righty combination is there. But I would say that question is not something which I would like to answer, to be very honest," was Kotak's diplomatic answer.Rohit's form will certainly also be a concern for the side, no matter how the management tries to brush aside any doubts regarding his continuous run of poor form. Rohit, incidentally, got out after scoring only two runs in the first ODI of this series.Rohit coming back into form will certainly be a big boost for the hosts ahead of the ICC event starting on Feb 19. The track looks a belter and could well be the right platform for the ‘Hitman' to get some much-needed runs under his belt.Meanwhile, KL Rahul is likely to get another look-in as the wicketkeeper-batter ahead of Rishabh Pant, who batted for long in the nets. However, left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh bowled long spells during the practice session and could replace Shami, who might be rested to manage his workload following a long injury layoff.Although dew factor is unlikely to come into play here, batting second will be the preferred choice, as chasing teams have won 12 out of the 19 ODIs played here over the years.

Former New York Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner and his wife, Jessica, are grieving the devastating loss of their 14-year-old son, Miller, who passed away on Friday after falling ill while on vacation.The couple shared the heartbreaking news in a statement released through the Yankees, revealing that Miller had become sick along with other family members. Despite their search for answers, they remain in shock over the sudden tragedy."With heavy hearts, we are saddened to announce the passing of our youngest son, Miller. He was 14 years old and has left us far too soon after falling ill along with several other family members while on vacation," the statement read. "We have so many questions and so few answers at this point, but we do know that he passed away peacefully in his sleep on the morning of Friday, March 21st."The grieving parents described Miller as a beloved son and brother whose infectious smile brightened the lives of those around him. He was passionate about football, baseball, golf, hunting, and fishing, and he cherished time with his family and friends.The Gardner family expressed gratitude for the outpouring of support they have received and requested privacy during this difficult time.The Yankees organisation also issued a heartfelt statement, mourning the loss of Miller and standing in solidarity with the Gardner family."Our hearts are heavy, and the Yankees family is filled with grief after learning of the passing of Miller Gardner ," the team said. "Words feel insignificant and insufficient in trying to describe such an unimaginable loss."The statement acknowledged Miller's vibrant spirit, describing him as having "a spark in his eyes, an outgoing and feisty personality, and a warm and loving nature." The Yankees emphasised their unwavering love and support for Brett, Jessica, and their son Hunter as they navigate this tragic time.Details regarding the location of the family's vacation remain unknown.Brett Gardner spent 14 seasons with the Yankees, helping the team secure its last World Series title in 2009. He retired following the 2021 season and has remained out of the baseball spotlight since.

They're very athletic, they're going to be a brave, brave cricket team," he said.With Ricky Ponting as head coach and Iyer at the helm, Punjab Kings have placed a strong emphasis on building a cohesive and dynamic unit. Haddin noted that the team possesses the flexibility to adapt to various match situations, thanks to a versatile lineup."We want to make sure that they play brave cricket and as per the situation in front of them. This is a new group. We have players in every position we needed who can adapt to play in different roles. I think we've got experience right through," he added.Haddin also praised the leadership of captain Shreyas Iyer, crediting him for fostering a culture of unity and commitment within the team."I think the culture is driven from our leaders. We have a very driven captain in Shreyas Iyer who has had a lot of success in this format of the game. He has brought everyone together. The staff is on the same page as the players. We are a really tight group, but it's been led by the standards and the habits that the captain sets," Haddin said.
Article Summary: Punjab Kings take on Gujarat Titans in their IPL 2025 opener on Tuesday. Assistant coach Brad Haddin admits that the team is yet to decide on an opening pair. Haddin remains optimistic about the team's overall preparation and readiness for the season.

The one who makes the world move. A leader is the one who moves forward. Man's rank is his ability to uplift. The one who instills faith in those who follow him. With their next fixture against Gujarat Titans still a few days away, the Hardik Pandya-led unit will be spending a couple of rest days in Jamnagar for team bonding activities before preparations for the next game take over.It wasn't an ideal start for a depleted Mumbai unit as they went down to CSK in their season opener. On a sluggish surface, the team never got going with the bat and didn't have enough runs on the board to challenge the opposition. They will be bolstered by the return of regular captain Hardik Pandya , who missed the opening game due to a slow-over rate penalty from last season.Pandya did travel with the team, hit some lusty blows in the nets and his presence was felt as MI missed his all-round abilities against Chennai. Suryakumar Yadav led the side in his absence but wasn't able to make a substantial contribution with the bat.Rohit Sharma too was dismissed for a duck and the only positives for MI in that game were the contributions made by Deepak Chahar and instant impact of Vignesh Puthur . The 24-year-old chinaman returned with three wickets and showed no signs of pressure whatsoever on the big stage, in front of a packed crowd.There is no return date for Jasprit Bumrah yet but Mumbai Indians bowling coach Paras Mhambrey said that he is making good progress, and the MI management is in constant touch with the medical team overseeing his rehabilitation at the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Centre of Excellence (CoE). Article Title: KL Rahul and Athiya Shetty blessed with a baby girl
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India and Delhi Capitals batter KL Rahul and his wife, Athiya Shetty , were blessed with a baby girl on Monday.Athiya shared the joyful news on Instagram, writing, "Blessed with a baby girl," as fans and well-wishers poured in their congratulations.Meanwhile, Rahul’s much-anticipated debut for his new IPL franchise, Delhi Capitals, left fans disappointed as he was absent from the playing XI in their season opener against Lucknow Super Giants at the ACA-VDCA Stadium in Visakhapatnam on Monday.Although captain Axar Patel did not mention Rahul’s absence during the toss, it was later confirmed that the cricketer had been granted special permission by the Delhi Capitals' management to skip the match to be with his wife during the special moment. Rahul reportedly rushed back to Mumbai on Sunday night to be by Athiya's side.KL Rahul is expected to rejoin the Delhi Capitals squad ahead of their second game against Sunrisers Hyderabad on March 30. Fans are eagerly awaiting his debut, as his presence in the lineup is crucial for the team’s campaign this season.
Article Summary: India and Delhi Capitals batter KL Rahul and his wife, Athiya Shetty, were blessed with a baby girl on Monday. Rahul’s much-anticipated debut for his new IPL franchise, Delhi Capitals, left fans disappointed as he was absent from the playing XI in their season opener.

Former Bangladesh one-day cricket captain Tamim Iqbal experienced a heart attack during a domestic cricket match on Monday and was rushed to the hospital.The 36-year-old was leading Mohammedan Sporting Club in a Dhaka Premier Division Cricket League 50-over match when the incident occurred.Although Tamim participated in the pre-match toss, he later reported chest pain and received initial treatment on the field before being transported to a hospital."He suffered a heart attack. This performance set a new record for the most expensive bowling figures in IPL history, surpassing Mohit Sharma's previous record of 0/73 for Gujarat Titans against Delhi Capitals.Sunrisers Hyderabad achieved a significant milestone by scoring their fourth 250-plus total in T20 cricket, setting a new record for any team ahead of India and Surrey.The team posted an impressive 286 for six against Rajasthan, falling just two runs short of breaking their own IPL record of 287/3, which they set against Royal Challengers Bengaluru last year.Ishan Kishan played a crucial role in the match, scoring his first IPL century off just 45 balls.Sunrisers Hyderabad secured a convincing 44-run victory over Rajasthan Royals to begin their campaign successfully.

Article Title: Who is Vignesh Puthur? Wrist spinner from Malappuram who took three wickets in CSK vs MI
Article Text:
Mumbai Indians' Vignesh Puthur celebrates after taking the wicket of Chennai Super Kings' Shivam Dube during IPL 2025. (PTI)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

MI in IPL 2025: After wooden spoon, Mumbai Indians target better show

IPL 2025: How will KKR, MI, CSK, SRH, RCB fare this season?

TimesofIndia.com in Chennai: Four players made their Indian Premier League debut in the Chennai Super Kings vs Mumbai Indians clash at Chepauk on Sunday but it was the little-known Vignesh Puthur who made a splash in front of a packed house. The 24-year-old chinaman bowler , son of an auto driver, from Malappuram in Kerala was the latest dispatch from MI's scouting stable, and the youngster made instant impact with 3/32 against a star-studded CSK outfit.Puthur's journey to MI's blue and gold is a fascinating one as he was picked up at the auction for Rs 30 lakh after an impressive show in the franchise's trials. Amongst the many who had assembled, Puthur caught the attention with his accuracy, consistent turn and ability to keep a cool head under pressure. It was enough to raise the paddle and from there on, the management chalked out a plan to groom the inexperienced spinner who had very little exposure at the higher level.The MI Cape Town unit was set to assemble in South Africa for the SA20 in January and Puthur was summoned as a net bowler and spent a lot of time working on his skills with the likes of Rashid Khan. The invaluable experience of rubbing shoulders with the greats of the game did his confidence a world of good and he even played three games for the Reliance team in the DY Patil T20 tournament before the pre-season preparations got underway.In the nets, during match simulations and practice fixtures, the management led by head coach Mahela Jayawardene were convinced to give the boy an early chance in the IPL and feedback from Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav also pushed his case."Rohit, Surya, Tillak, all these guys batted against him (in the nets)... it wasn't easy that easy (to pick him). So one of the reasons we felt that we have the confidence of pushing him in this game. And it turned out to be excellent. It was a good decision," said MI bowling coach Paras Mhambrey .He lavished praise on the scouting team, who unearthed Puthur from the Kerala Cricket League, for unearthing a talent like him and further explained what they look for when picking these youngsters."We have good guys who can spot talent. I think the idea with MI is seeing the potential more than anything else. And when we saw him for one of our trials, we saw the potential in him. Rather than looking into how much cricket he's played in the past. But it's purely thought that he has the potential. And you saw that today," added Mhambrey.Amidst deafening whistles and chants, Puthur returned with the wickets of Ruturaj Gaikwad, Shivam Dube and Deepak Hooda but what impressed the MI dugout the most was his ability to hold nerves and handle the pressure. It was something they had worked on behind the scenes and the regular conversations with coaches Mahela, Kieron Pollard and senior players like Rohit helped Puthur understand his role, expectations of the team and the culture of the MI dressing room."Yes, he hasn't played much cricket. But we got an opportunity where he worked a little bit. Got an opportunity to work with him after we had a couple of trials. Not purely on the skill work so much really. I think that he is pretty much sorted out there I feel. But more about the conversations that he had an opportunity with MJ. Or Pollard. Or the batters, especially Surya and Rohit. I think that really helped with him in understanding the requirements. And understanding his role in the team. And what we expect out of him," explained Mhambrey.Sharing the dressing room with India and overseas stars, having a post-match chat with MS Dhoni is the stuff dreams are made of, and Puthur lived that on Sunday night. The social media traction sky-rocketed in lightning quick time but the bowling coach asserts he is a "sweet kid" just soaking it all in "like a sponge"."He's a lovely kid to have in the team. He's more like a sponge right now, just absorbing everything, looking around, you know, having conversations. I thought not everyone gets an opportunity in a dressing room to get an opportunity to chat with MJ, someone who has so much experience. Surya, Tilak, Rohit, you know, all these guys. He's just listening."You have heroes, you see them playing on the TV, and all of a sudden you're sharing that dressing room with them, sitting next to someone like Rohit. It's a dream come true for a lot of these guys, right? But purely the way he responded... never looked like he was under pressure from the very first ball. And that was good to see," says Mhambrey.The first impression has been a good one and now everyone in the MI dugout would hope it turns out to be a long and successful innings like their previous boy wonders - Jasprit Bumrah, Hardik Pandya, Krunal Pandya, Tilak Varma - who went on to become household names.
Article Summary: Vignesh Puthur made his IPL debut against Chennai Super Kings on Sunday. The 24-year-old chinaman bowler was picked up at the auction for Rs 30 lakh. He took 3/32 against a star-studded CSK outfit at Chepauk.

Article Title: IPL 2025: Born-again Ishan Kishan leads with ton as SRH fire first salvo
Article Text:
Sunrisers Hyderabad's Ishan Kishan celebrates his century during the match against Rajasthan Royals in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad. (ANI)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

SRH in IPL 2025: Sunrisers Hyderabad target title with big-hitting players

RR in IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals hope for first title in 17 years

Brief scores: SRH 286/6

beat RR 242/6

by 44 runs.

Hyderabad: Ishan Kishan made a sensational debut for his new team on Sunday. A stunning maiden, unbeaten 106 (47b, 11x4, 6x6) by the southpaw set up last year’s runners-up Sunrisers Hyderabad ’s 44-run win over Rajasthan Royals Courtesy the blitzkrieg, SRH racked up the league’s second-highest total of 286/6, just shy of their record of 287/3 they set against Royal Challengers Bengaluru last season. SRH now have the most 250+ totals — four — in IPL . Chasing an imposing target, the visitors, who played into SRH’s hands by inviting them to bat first on a belter, finished at 242/6.Ishan, whose first reaction after being acquired by SRH for Rs 11.25 crore at the mega auction was to call SRH opener Abhishek Sharma and ask what was expected of him, said 300 crossed his mind. “In the middle someone came with the message saying that we have to achieve that target. I said I didn’t know we had a target in mind. But, it is good posting such big totals,” said Ishan.Sunday’s innings could well prove a giant first step for Kishan’s return into national reckoning, after a couple of bleak seasons that may have forced introspection and a rekindling of ambition. It was such a rollicking start to his SRH stint that even the Rajasthan Royals batting coach Vikram Rathour had words of appreciation — “when someone scores a century of that kind, there is everything to like about it.”Kishan later said that the flying kisses after reaching his century were meant for his fans and his brother — Raj Kishan — who was in the stands. The SRH No. 3 credited the team management for his hurricane knock. “It was important for me to gain confidence from the start. The captain is so supportive, and the coach is on the mark. He told me that if the ball is in my slot, I should go for it. That sort of confidence from your team captain is a big boost,” Ishan said later.He justified coach Daniel Vettori’s faith by sending the Rajasthan bowlers on a leather hunt after SRH’s opening duo of Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma smashed 45 runs in 3.1 overs before Sharma was dismissed by Maheesh Theekshana.Head plundered 23 runs (4x4, 1x6) off Jofra Archer’s first over, as the Englishman had the ignominy of returning the worst figures in the league. His none for 76 eclipsed Mohit Sharma’s none for 73 for Gujarat.Kishan and Head took the hosts to 94/1 in the Powerplay and galloped past 100 in 6.4 overs. Head reached his fifty off 21 deliveries, but two overs later he departed hitting straight to Shimron Hetmyer off Tushar Deshpande. Head and Kishan added 85 off 39 balls as the hosts reached 135/2 at the halfway stage. Kishan and Nitish Kumar Reddy (30 off 15b, 4x4, 1x6) never took their foot off the pedal.Kishan clobbered Archer for three sixes in the 13th over and another off Farooqi as the hosts reached 200 in the 15th over. Heinrich Klaasen then took over, smacking 34 off just 14 deliveries (5x4, 1x6).After adding 56 runs with Kishan, Klaasen holed out in the penultimate over. But Kishan smashed two sixes and ran a brace in the same over to reach his century off 45 deliveries.At 273/3 in 19 overs, the hosts looked like getting the highest total overall. But Deshpande bowled a good final over.(Ishan Kishan 106 not out, Travis Head 67, Heinrich Klaasen 34, Nitish Kumar Reddy 30; Tushar Deshpande 3/44)(Dhruv Jurel 70, Sanju Samson 66, Shimron Hetmyer 42, Shubham Dubey 34 not out; Harshal Patel 2/34)
Article Summary: Sunrisers Hyderabad beat Rajasthan Royals by 44 runs in IPL 2025. Ishan Kishan scored unbeaten 106 (47b, 11x4, 6x6) to set up victory. Hosts posted second- highest total of 286/6, just shy of their record of 287/3.

Article Title: IPL 2025, CSK vs MI Highlights: Noor Ahmad's dream debut helps Chennai Super Kings outclass Mumbai Indians
Article Text:
Chennai Super Kings' Noor Ahmad celebrates with teammate after taking a wicket. (PTI Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

As it happened:

NEW DELHI: Afghanistan's mystery spinner Noor Ahmad made an unforgettable debut for Chennai Super Kings (CSK), claiming a sensational four-wicket haul to script a memorable four-wicket win over Mumbai Indians (MI) in their IPL 2025 opener at the MA Chidambaram Stadium, Chennai, on Sunday.Ahmad’s figures of 4 for 18 were not only the best by any CSK spinner against MI but also pivotal in restricting the visitors to a modest 155/9 on a typically slow Chepauk surface.In a match that continued MI's unfortunate streak of not winning their opening game since 2012, Noor Ahmad was the undeniable game-changer. His spell broke the backbone of MI's batting, leaving them struggling to gain any momentum. After Khaleel Ahmed (3/29) struck early by dismissing Rohit Sharma for a duck and Ryan Rickelton for 13, Ahmad took over the middle overs with his deceptive variations.The highlight of Ahmad’s spell came when he dismissed MI's stand-in captain Suryakumar Yadav (29 off 26) with a lightning-quick stumping by MS Dhoni , who showcased his evergreen reflexes behind the stumps. Dhoni’s brilliance not only highlighted his continued prowess but also underlined Ahmad’s skill to fox the batter with a well-disguised delivery.Ahmad followed it up by trapping Tilak Varma (31 off 25) with a googly and dismissing Robin Minz and Naman Dhir in quick succession. The MI middle-order was left in tatters as Ahmad's wizardry spun them into disarray.Despite Deepak Chahar’s late resistance with a fiery 28 off 15 balls, MI could only muster 155/9, a total that never looked threatening.Chasing 156, CSK got off to a steady start, anchored by skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad, who smashed 53 off 26 balls before falling to IPL debutant Vignesh Puthur (3/32). Puthur briefly troubled CSK with his left-arm spin, removing Gaikwad, Shivam Dube and Deepak Hooda in quick succession. However, Rachin Ravindra’s unbeaten 65 off 45 balls ensured CSK’s march towards victory.The crowd erupted when MS Dhoni walked out to bat with just four runs needed, but it was Ravindra who sealed the win with a towering six, as CSK reached the target in 19.1 overs.With this victory, CSK extended their dominance over MI, having won six of the last seven head-to-head encounters since the second leg of IPL 2021.
Article Summary: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) beat Mumbai Indians (MI) by four wickets in their IPL 2025 opener at the MA Chidambaram Stadium, Chennai, on Sunday. Afghanistan's mystery spinner Noor Ahmad made an unforgettable debut for CSK, claiming a sensational four-wicket haul. Rachin Ravindra's unbeaten 65 off 45 balls ensured CSK’s march towards victory. MI could only muster 155/9, a total that never looked threatening.
